sentences: See probleem esineb paljudes riikides üle terve maailma.
context: The word 'maailmas' is an Estonian adessive case form of the noun 'maailm', which means 'world'. The essive case in Estonian typically indicates location or state, so 'maailmas' translates to 'in the world' and indicates position within the global context. It can also be used more broadly to mean 'worldwide' or 'globally' when referring to something that extends across the entire world.
